content: tilt is a sock with four different panels of colour meandering gently around the foot and ankle twist is a more aggressive version with the colours swirling around at twice the speed this is a sock recipe that assumes you already have a basic knowledge of sock knitting the pattern can be knit as written or you can add the colour pattern instructions to your favourite plain toe-up sock pattern these instructions are for a toe-up sock but could easily be converted for cuff-down construction as written the length of the foot is approx 9 and heel to top of cuff is approx 7 these were designed for the sock knitters anonymous december 2012 stashbuster challenge and as such are great for using up leftovers what you will need 5 different colours of fingering weight sock yarn weights given are overestimated to err on the side of caution your mileage may vary if basing the pattern on a different basic sock pattern colour a approx 25g for toes heels and cuffs colours b c d and e approx 16-18g each as written colours b and d will use slightly less than c and e 2mm double point needles circular methods may instead be used if desired or needles sized to get a gauge of 9-10 stitches and 12-13 row per inch stitch markers if desired instructions are written for 5 dpn yarn used in photos is elann essential 4ply red heart heart and sole regia galaxy online supersocke 100 candy colour and online supersocke 100 jungle colour **errata round 4 of initial repeat of pattern should read as for round 2 not round 3 as per version 2 of pdf the ravelry download file version 3 has been updated to reflect this correction ** this pattern is intended for personal not-for-profit use only
